item.title: Marty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Marty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "History doesn't repeat itself, but it does rhyme." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Often it does seem such a pity that Noah and his party did not miss the boat." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marty add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "Spiders so large they appear to be wearing the pelts of small mammals." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Marty add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "As you get older; you've probably noticed that you tend to forget things. You'll be talking with somebody at a party, and you'll know that you know this person, but no matter how hard you try, you can't remember his or her name. This can be very embarassing, especially if he or she turns out to be your spouse." -- Dave Barry
